text:
After upgrade from 1.x to 2.0.39, a previously-working httpd.conf file now 
gives the following error:

Syntax error on line 215 of /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf:
Cannot load /etc/httpd/modules/mod_log_config.so into 
server: /etc/httpd/modules/mod_log_config.so: undefined symbol: 
ap_escape_logitem

For this line in the log file:
LoadModule config_log_module  modules/mod_log_config.so
creator: pauleckert@architecturalengineers.com

text:
You're trying to load mod_log_config from Apache 1.3.  Apache 2.0, and its
mod_log_config, do not have the symbol ap_escape_logitem.
creator: trawick@apache.org
